senses.de: A problem or fault in something
senses.ex: The car has a major defect in its braking system.

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: The term often implies something undesirable or unwanted in an object or system.
Tips.example: The smartphone was returned due to a screen defect.

Tips.title: Potential Severity
Tips.description: 'Defect' can suggest varying levels of severity, from minor to critical.
Tips.example: A minor defect in the paintwork doesn't affect the car's performance.

Tips.title: Not Always Visible
Tips.description: Some defects are not immediately apparent and may be discovered later.
Tips.example: After a week, we noticed a defect in the TV's sound quality.

senses.de: To leave a country, political party, etc., especially to go somewhere or join something else
senses.ex: He defected from the party when he didn't agree with the party's policies.

Tips.title: Significant Change
Tips.description: As a verb, 'defect' involves a serious change, like leaving one's country or party.
Tips.example: She defected to the rival company due to better opportunities.

Tips.title: Imply Disapproval
Tips.description: It can imply negative judgment, suggesting disloyalty or betrayal.
Tips.example: The scientist defected to another country during the war.

senses.de: An imperfection in a person's body or mind
senses.ex: He was born with a heart defect.

Tips.title: Beyond Control
Tips.description: A medical defect is usually an inborn condition, not a result of choice.
Tips.example: She has overcome the challenges posed by her vision defect.

Tips.title: Sensitive Topic
Tips.description: Speaking of medical defects requires sensitivity to avoid offending someone.
Tips.example: When discussing her speech defect, it's important to be understanding.

Tips.title: Varied Impact
Tips.description: Such defects can vary in impact, from minor inconveniences to major disabilities.
Tips.example: His genetic defect has minimal impact on his daily life.

Aberration.wordDefinition:
Aberration refers to something that deviates from what is considered normal or expected. It could be a behavior, condition or situation that is unusual, strange or out of the ordinary.

For example, if a straight stick looks bent in water due to the bending of light rays, that is an aberration.

Aberration is when something is not usual, and defect is when something is broken or not working as expected.

Aberration is applicable in situations where there is a departure from the normal or expected, while defect is applicable when something is flawed or faulty.

Anomaly.wordDefinition:
Anomaly refers to something that is different from what is considered normal or expected.

It can be positive or negative, meaning it can be something unique or unusual but not necessarily bad. For example, a rare flower species could be considered an anomaly.

Anomaly refers to something unusual or different, while defect has a negative connotation and refers to something that is broken or malfunctioning.

Blemish.wordDefinition:
The words blemish and defect both refer to a flaw or imperfection in something, but they have slightly different meanings.

A blemish usually refers to a small or minor imperfection that doesn't affect the overall function or quality of something.

For example, a blemish on someone's skin might be a small spot or mark, while a blemish on a piece of furniture might be a small scratch or dent.

So, blemishes are generally more superficial and cosmetic, while defects are more serious and can affect the usefulness or safety of something.

Fault.wordDefinition:
Both the words defect and fault refer to some problem or issue with something, but there is a slight difference in their usage.

A fault refers to a mistake or error in something that was caused by someone or something. For example, if a car doesn't start because the mechanic forgot to connect a wire properly, then it's a fault.

Defect describes a problem with a product or thing itself, whereas fault describes a problem caused by human error or mistake.

Flaw.wordDefinition:
Both defect and flaw refer to something that is not working or functioning correctly.

However, defect usually refers to a problem or issue with the manufacturing or construction of a product, while flaw usually refers to a problem or issue with the design or composition of a product.

For example, a defect in a car might be a faulty engine part, while a flaw in a car might be poor visibility due to the design of the car's windows.

Defect implies a problem with the product's manufacturing process, while flaw implies a problem with the product's overall design or composition.

Imperfection.wordDefinition:
An imperfection refers to a small mistake or flaw that doesn't necessarily impact the function of something. For example, a painting might have some imperfections in the brushstrokes, but it can still be enjoyed and appreciated.

Overall, defects are more serious and impactful than imperfections.

Malfunction.wordDefinition:
Malfunction refers to a failure or breakdown in the operation of a device, machine, or system.

It can be caused by a defect or a variety of other factors such as misuse, wear and tear, or environmental conditions. For example, a computer that malfunctions may not turn on or may freeze during use.

A defect is a flaw in the design or production of an object, while a malfunction is a failure in its operation. Both terms are used to describe issues with products or technology, but the context and specific circumstances will determine which word is more appropriate.

Shortcoming.wordDefinition:
A shortcoming is a weakness or limitation in something that may not necessarily prevent it from functioning, but could make it less effective or efficient.

For example, a smartphone might have a shortcoming in its battery life, meaning it needs to be charged more frequently than would be ideal.

However, defects are generally more serious and can pose safety risks, while shortcomings may be less critical but can still impact performance or satisfaction.

Weak.wordDefinition:
Weak refers to something that is not strong or effective.

It can apply to physical objects, like a weak chair that might break if too much weight is put on it, or to abstract concepts, like a weak argument that can't stand up to criticism.

To sum it up, a defect is a specific flaw or problem that prevents something from working correctly, while weak describes something that is not strong or effective in general.

quotes.Text: These technologies can make life easier, can let us touch people we might not otherwise. You may have a child with a birth defect and be able to get in touch with other parents and support groups, get medical information, the latest experimental drugs. These things can profoundly influence life. I'm not downplaying that.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Steve Jobs

quotes.Text: I'm a man with many defects. I love. I sing. I dream. I was born in the poor countryside. I was raised in the countryside, planting corn and selling sweets made by my grandmother. My children, my two daughters are with me and I want a better world for my grandchildren, for your grandchildren.
quotes.Title: Statesman
quotes.Name: Hugo Chavez

quotes.Text: We were at a beach one summer, and I had a bathing suit on. My wife looked at me and said: 'Boy, you are skinny, aren't you?' I said: 'Honey, I'd like to remind you that it was minor defects like this that kept me from getting a better wife.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Lou Holtz

quotes.Text: It is a most delightful reflection that if I come to the throne of God in prayer, I may feel a thousand defects, but yet there is hope. I usually feel more dissatisfied with my prayers than with anything else I do.
quotes.Title: British Clergyman
quotes.Name: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.Text: Children are excellent observers, and will often perceive your slightest defects. In general, those who govern children, forgive nothing in them, but everything in themselves.
quotes.Title: French Clergyman
quotes.Name: Francois Fenelon

quotes.Text: There is something wrong about the man who wants help. There is somewhere a deep defect, a want, in brief, a need, a crying need, somewhere about that man.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Herman Melville

quotes.Text: Time, which alone makes the reputation of men, ends by making their defects respectable.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Voltaire

quotes.Text: Weakness of character is the only defect which cannot be amended.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.Text: No change of circumstances can repair a defect of character.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.Text: Being positive may be a character defect of mine.
quotes.Title: English Cartoonist
quotes.Name: Quentin Blake
